SENT.plain: A 50-year-old woman with antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APAS) awoke in a morning to notice dizziness, so she came to our hospital
Several hours later she developed left oculomotor paralysis
Further two hours later she developed right oculomotor paralysis and could not stand
Brain MRI showed high signal intensity lesion of paramedian thalamic and midbrain on the T2-weighted image
Cerebral angiography did not reveal any occlusion
Transesophageal echocardiography disclosed mitral valvular vegetation
We thought this valvular abnormality was non-bacterial thrombotic vegetation associated with APAS and this suggests that cerebral infarction was due to emboli from this vegetation
